March 2020 County of Marin EMS BLS N2
SEIZURE
Indications
• Patient with reported or continuing seizure activity
BLS RMC
Active
Post-Seizure (post-ictal)
• Protect patient from injury (move
• Protect patient from injury (move
furniture, etc)
furniture, etc)
• Consider possible treatment of
• Consider possible treatment of
diabetic patient (see ALOC)
diabetic patient (see ALOC)
• Frequently evaluate patient’s
level of consciousness and
anticipate recurring seizures
If febrile seizure
• Suction as needed
• Initiate cooling measures
If febrile seizure
• Initiate cooling measures
Transfer care to ALS personnel as soon as possible
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
• Consider treatable etiologies: hypoglycemia, hypoxia, narcotic overdose, unusual
odor of alcohol, signs of trauma, medic alert tag
• Be attentive to excessive oral secretions, vomiting, and ineffective breathing
• Treatment should be based on the severity and length of the seizure activity
